page.title: 15Playground Games
page.content: These examples of playground games were being played by the children of Heybridge School in the Summer of 1985. The main individual and small group games were hopscotch, marbles and{skipping.}(There are some examples of skipping rhymes on Page 18). These games explained below are large group games. *Family Had or Bulldog* Someone is chosen to be "up" and all the other people stand in a semi circle on the netball pitch.The people in the semi circle run to a certain place,for example another semi circle or a wall.To play, you need somewhere to start and somewhere to run.If you are caught by the "up" person while you're running you are "up" as well. This continues until everyone is caught.The first one caught is the first one "up" next time.
